heroIntro: Welcome to your family's next chapter in Javea. This 3-bedroom villa offers the perfect balance of space to grow and community living that families seek on the Costa Blanca. Located in Tarraula, this property is competitively priced at €375,000—matching Javea's €3,200/m² average—making it exceptional value in a region where quality family homes are in high demand. With excellent schools nearby, safe neighborhoods, and a strong expat community where English is spoken everywhere, this villa provides the ideal foundation for your family's Mediterranean lifestyle. Whether you're seeking a permanent residence or a holiday investment property, this Javea home delivers on practicality, location, and value. areaSection: Javea, nestled on the northern Costa Blanca between Valencia and Alicante, is a coastal town of around 30,000 residents with a distinctly Mediterranean character. The town enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually and a mild climate year-round, making it ideal for families seeking outdoor living. Javea's geography combines dramatic rocky coastline with sandy beaches and charming coves, while the Montgo mountain backdrop provides stunning vistas. The town has developed into a sophisticated yet relaxed destination, maintaining its authentic Spanish character while welcoming an international community. This balance—modern amenities with traditional Spanish culture—makes Javea increasingly popular with families relocating from northern Europe seeking better weather, quality of life, and educational opportunities.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Javea revolves around outdoor activities, community, and Mediterranean rhythms. The town boasts four Blue Flag beaches including Arenal with its golden sand, plus hidden coves like Granadella perfect for family swimming. The large British, German, and Dutch expat community means excellent English support for newcomers—from healthcare to education to daily services. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Consum, and Masymas supermarkets, plus the British Corner Shop for familiar items. Weekly markets offer fresh local produce, and the town's restaurants range from casual family-friendly spots to fine dining. Schools are accessible, with Xàbia International College offering British curriculum education. Healthcare is excellent, with Hospital de Dénia just 15 minutes away and many English-speaking doctors throughout town. Weekend activities include golf at Jávea Golf Club, ferry trips from nearby Dénia to Ibiza and Mallorca, and exploring the natural beauty of the Montgo peninsula.
investmentSection: This €375,000 villa represents strong investment potential in a market experiencing +6% year-on-year growth. Javea properties consistently attract international buyers, with typical weekly rental rates around €1,400 for 3-bedroom homes—indicating solid income potential if you choose to let the property. Compared to Mallorca, which typically commands 30% higher prices for similar properties, this Javea villa offers exceptional value. The town's growing appeal with families and retirees, combined with its proximity to Valencia and Alicante airports, creates sustained demand. Whether purchased as a family residence or investment property, this villa benefits from Javea's established infrastructure, growing expat population, and consistent tourist appeal. The Costa Blanca's market trajectory suggests continued appreciation, while rental demand remains strong year-round due to both holiday tourism and long-term winter lets from northern Europeans.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom villa in Tarraula represents an exceptional opportunity for families seeking authentic Mediterranean living without premium pricing. At €375,000, it's competitively positioned in Javea's market, offers proven investment potential with +6% annual appreciation, and provides access to everything your family needs: excellent schools, safe neighborhoods, beautiful beaches, reliable healthcare, and a welcoming international community. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Living in Javea means accessing all essential services and amenities within minutes. The town provides comprehensive healthcare, international education, modern shopping, and efficient transport links—all while maintaining the relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle families seek. English is widely spoken, making daily life straightforward for international residents.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Javea is excellent and accessible to English speakers. Hospital de Dénia, just 15 minutes away, is the primary medical facility offering emergency services and specialist care. The town has numerous clinics and health centers with English-speaking doctors, including private practitioners and dental services. Pharmacies are conveniently located throughout town. Many healthcare professionals have experience with international patients, and medical tourism standards are high. For emergencies, the healthcare system is modern and reliable. Health insurance arrangements are straightforward for EU and non-EU residents, with both public and private options available.

education.text: Javea offers excellent international education options, particularly important for relocating families. Xàbia International College provides British curriculum education and is highly regarded by expat families. Laude Lady Elizabeth School, 20 minutes away in Benidorm, offers an additional prestigious option. Local Spanish schools are also available and welcoming to international families. The international school community in Javea is well-established, meaning your children will integrate easily with other expat families while receiving quality education. Many families choose to combine international schooling with Spanish language immersion to ensure bilingual capabilities.

shopping.text: Shopping in Javea caters to both Spanish and international tastes. Mercadona, the primary supermarket chain, is conveniently located with multiple branches. Consum and Masymas offer additional grocery options. The British Corner Shop stocks familiar products from the UK, helping expats access home comforts. Weekly markets provide fresh local produce at excellent prices, supporting the farm-to-table lifestyle many families enjoy. Larger shopping centers are available in nearby towns for specialist needs. The town center offers independent shops, pharmacies, and services within walking distance of residential areas.

transport.text: Javea offers good transport connectivity for families. Alicante Airport, 90 minutes south, provides international flight options. Valencia Airport, 120 minutes north, offers additional connections. Local bus services connect Javea to Dénia, Benidorm, and Alicante. The town is car-friendly with reasonable parking availability, and most families find a vehicle useful for exploring the Costa Blanca. Driving times are manageable—Valencia city center is 2 hours, Barcelona 3.5 hours. Dénia's ferry port (20 minutes away) provides interesting weekend options with connections to Ibiza and Mallorca. For getting around town, walking and bicycles are practical options given Javea's compact size.

faqs.question: Is Javea good for families?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Javea is one of the Costa Blanca's most family-friendly locations, with excellent international schools (Xàbia International College), safe neighborhoods, multiple beaches, active expat community with strong English-language support, and comprehensive healthcare. The town offers outdoor activities, reliable amenities, and a proven track record welcoming relocating families.

faqs.question: Is Javea expensive to live?
faqs.answer: No, Javea is reasonably priced compared to other premium coastal areas. At €3,200/m² average, it's 30% less expensive than Mallorca and offers good value for Mediterranean coastal living. This particular villa at €375,000 is competitively positioned within the local market, with strong potential for rental income (€1,400/week typical) if purchased as investment property.

faqs.question: Why is Javea so popular?
faqs.answer: Javea combines several appealing factors: excellent weather (300+ days sunshine), beautiful beaches with Blue Flag designations, strong international community with English spoken widely, good schools, reliable healthcare, reasonable cost of living, and strategic location between Valencia and Alicante airports. It's become increasingly popular with families seeking Mediterranean lifestyle without the costs of premium destinations.

faqs.question: How far is Javea from Valencia airport?
faqs.answer: Javea is approximately 120 minutes (100km) from Valencia Airport by car. Alicante Airport is closer at 90 minutes (100km). Both airports offer international connections, and the journey is straightforward via major highways. Direct bus services also operate from both airports to the town.

faqs.answer: Yes, Javea has excellent international school options. Laude Lady Elizabeth School in nearby Benidorm (20 minutes) is another prestigious option. Spanish public schools are also available and welcoming to international families, many offering bilingual programs.

faqs.question: Is Javea better than Benidorm for families?
faqs.answer: Both towns offer family appeal, but Javea is generally preferred for families seeking quieter living. Javea offers a more relaxed atmosphere, excellent schools, and a strong expat community, while Benidorm has more nightlife and tourism infrastructure. This property in Javea would suit families wanting Mediterranean lifestyle without the party-town atmosphere.
